title: bug(forge): coverage takes a very long time when invariant tests are included
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [ ] Foundry
- [ ] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (58a2729 2023-05-16T00:06:18.519004000Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge coverage --match-path "test/invariant/**/*.sol"

### Operating System

macOS (Apple Silicon)

### Describe the bug

The `forge coverage` command is unusable with invariant tests. Here's how long my invariant tests take to run normally:

https://app.warp.dev/block/FObNIsh7boJJYzRFqLwS1Y

And here's what happens when I run `forge coverage` (the command does not finish running even after 10 minutes):

https://app.warp.dev/block/iM1hbmlzW9hPCwbmnUgce2

My hunch is that `forge coverage` recompiles the contracts on every invariant run, and this is what causes the slow execution. However, I can't know for sure because there's no progress reported for invariants (ref https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/issues/3277).

I can put together a dedicated repo for reproducing the bug, but doing so should be pretty easy to do in any Foundry project with invariants.

**Update**: my most recent CI run (which used the same settings as I did locally in the permalink above) just finished, and it took 37 minutes to run the coverage command over a set of invariant tests that take ~28 seconds to run directly.
